Changing Server Configuration Properties

From your workstation, you can change information for an existing server configuration, including its name and address, the protocol for accessing it, and whether transferred data is encrypted and/or compressed.

To edit information for an existing server configuration:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • On a computer that has the Server installed, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam Server x.x > StarTeam Server.

    • From the client, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam client_name > Server Administration (available with custom installations only).

    The Server Administration dialog appears.

  2. If the server configuration is not already running, start it. See Starting and Stopping a Server Configuration.

  3. Select a server configuration from the left pane. If you have not already logged in, you will be asked to do so. If you are using the client, you can administer remote servers only.

  4. Click the Server Properties icon or select Server > Properties from the menu. The Server Properties dialog opens.

  5. On the Server Properties dialog, you can:

    1. Edit the name in the Server Description text box. This server configuration name should be unique. It is case-insensitive and cannot contain colons (:).

    2. Enter or browse for the address in the Server Address text box. The address is the computer name or IP address.

    3. Enter the required information in the TCP/IP Endpoint text box. The endpoint is the port number. The default is 49201.

    4. Select the Compress Transferred Data check box to compress all stored files.

    5. To protect project files and other information from being read by unauthorized parties over unsecured network lines, select an appropriate Encryption Level.

  6. Click OK to confirm the changes.
